title: ASEAN Para Games opening ceremony to celebrate triumph of human spirit
text:
ASEAN Para Games opening ceremony to celebrate triumph of human spirit Performers at the Opening Ceremony preview on Oct 20, 2015. Photo: Don Wong/TODAY Published: 4:05 PM, October 20, 2015 Updated: 6:11 PM, October 20, 2015 
SINGAPORE – The 8th ASEAN Para Games Opening Ceremony is set to feature five segments that celebrate the strengths of people of all abilities. 
The opening ceremony, which will take place on Dec 3 at the Singapore Indoor Stadium, will feature five acts - “Stretching the boundaries,” “A world of creative possibilities,” “Shooting for the best,” “Fire your imagination,” and “Celebration of the extraordinary.” 
The 90-minute spectacle, which is due to begin at 8pm, will feature 174 volunteers, 120 motivators, 454 students and 661 performers, with a 30-minute pre-show audience interaction segment also on the agenda. 
In a media release today (Oct 20), the Singapore ASEAN Para Games Organising (SAPGOC) committee said the show is “anchored and inspired by persons with disabilities”. 
“The ceremony will involve athletes, students, volunteers, industry professionals with a wide range of talents coming together to show that in order to achieve excellence, we all need to embody the same hunger and fighting spirits of our athletes,” it read. 
The opening ceremony is set to infuse both sports and arts with formal aspects of the ceremony, such as oath taking and the torch relay, meticulously woven with the narrative of the performance. 
It will be spearheaded by creative and music director Philip Tan, who has been working on this project for the past two years together with a team of eight others. He said: “While this event may be the finale of SG50, it will mark the beginning of a new friendship where we come together to learn from one another.” 
SAPGOC chairman Lim Teck Yin said the opening ceremony will involve people from all woks of life. 
“The 8th ASEAN Para Games is set to be the most inclusive sporting event ever held in Singapore. The opening ceremony is no exception,” he said. “Just as how our Team Singapore athletes competing in the games amplify the spirit of courage and determination, we hope that the community at large too, will be inspired to celebrate the triumph of the human spirit and to live better through sport.” 
Tickets for the opening ceremony are priced at S$20 while there’s also a concession price for youths (2-18 years old), NSF and seniors (50 years and above) at S$10. 
Members of the public can purchase tickets at sportshubtix.sg, at the Singapore Sports Hub box office, or at all SingPost outlets starting this Friday (Oct 23). However, those who have registered their interest in August 2015 can start purchasing their tickets today.
